[Verse]
[ch]Em[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]C[/ch]
  So close no matter how far

  Every day for us something new

This is usually the version Noel does when he is playing an acoustic set.
For most chords, keep your ring finger and pinky on the B and high E strings
In the bridge, on the words 'revolution, 'had' and 'summertimes' slide your first finger to the first fret on
on the same string.
After the last two Cadd9 chords, when there is a * slide your first finger to the first fret again.

Yellow-Live Acoustic

what i'm tabbed is very simple to play,no capo,in standard tuning system,easy to perform 
anywhere but sounds great.......

**MAIN TRACK IS IN [ch]E[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]D#[/ch] tuning**

So u can play in EADGBD# by flatting the high e string
or play in standard tuning-=both sounds great.. 

[CHORDS]
***This is the important part- chords played in different manner but more easily..***
B= 7(with thumb if u can or mute it with thumb) 9 9 8 0 0
F#=2(with thumb if u can or mute it with thumb) 4 4 3 0 0
E=0 2 2 1 0 0

So the thing is slide the E chord form build with middle,ring and pinky fingers
from 7th fret to 2nd then to open E form (whole verse is played like this)

G#m= 4(with thumb if u can or mute it with thumb) 6 6 4 0 0
F#m= 2(with thumb if u can or mute it with thumb) 4 4 2 0 0

[Chord progression & lyrics]

[Intro]
B=7 9 9 8 0 0 /  B= 7 x 9 9 0 0 (switch in last bar)
F#=2 4 4 3 0 0 / F#=2 x 4 4 0 0 (switch in last bar)
